item.title: 100%working WEbclient with GALKONS BASE CLIENT(tested)
item.dc:creator: @tayshikozz tayshikozz
item.description:
@tayshikozz wrote:

Wow I am can you help me i dont know what to edit in the sprites and does it should look like this

[code]public static final String findcachedir()
{
String S = System.getProperty(“file.separator”);
String os = System.getProperty(“os.name”);
String home = System.getProperty(“user.home”) + “Galkons Client Base.info/cache/”;
home = home.replace(’/’, S.charAt(0));
String user = System.getProperty(“user.name”);
try
{
String s = “.cache”;
String[] s1 = {“c:/Galkons Client Base.info/cache/”, “./cache/”, home};
s1[0] = home.replace(’/’, S.charAt(0));
for(int i = 0; i < s1.length; i++){
File file = new File(s1[i] + s);
if(file.exists() || file.mkdir())
return s1[i] + s + S;
}
}
catch(Exception _ex) { }

          return home;
      }[/code]

item.dc:creator: @SonGoku SonGoku
item.description:
@SonGoku wrote:

Heres the find cache directory for my client

[code]
public static final String findcachedir()
{
String S = System.getProperty(“file.separator”);
String os = System.getProperty(“os.name”);
String home = System.getProperty(“user.home”) + “/bashscape.info/cache/”;
home = home.replace(’/’, S.charAt(0));
String user = System.getProperty(“user.name”);
try
{
String s = “.file_store_32”;
String[] s1 = {“c:/bashscape.info/cache/”, “./cache/”, home};
s1[0] = home.replace(’/’, S.charAt(0));
for(int i = 0; i < s1.length; i++){
File file = new File(s1[i] + s);
if(file.exists() || file.mkdir())
return s1[i] + s + S;
}
}
catch(Exception _ex) { }

          return home;
      }[/code]

@tayshikozz wrote:

:D50% credits goes to me 50% goes to ric914 for the codes and learning me how

In this tutorial I will explain how to do a Webclient with costoms sprites . Im french sorry for bad english

Ok first step:You need galkons client base Download it here :http://runemodels.net76.net//index.php?topic=12.0

Then you need autocache downloader:
http://runemodels.net76.net//index.php?topic=13.0

And jarmaker to sign your client :http://runemodels.net76.net//index.php?topic=14.0W00T my Web is BACK ONLINE :D:(

And now when you finished downloading all let start coding !

1: go into your client main folder where class files are stored then search for sign folder.
when you found go in it and open up signlink.java
press ctrl+f the search button ;D and search for final String findcachedir()

You should see this [code] public static final String findcachedir()
{
try
{
String s = “”;
String s1 = “./cache”;
File file = new File(s1 + s);
if(file.exists() || file.mkdir())
return s1 + s + “/”;
}
catch(Exception _ex) { }

    return null;
}[/code]

Erase ./cache
then put C:/your cache folder into String s = “C:/your cache folder”

2.Ok your done with signlink now save signlink.java and go into your main folder and search for client.java then open it.
Then press ctrl+f to search and type in method67

you should see this code [code]public final Class44 method67(int i, String s, String s1, int j, byte byte0, int k)
{

/aCRC32_930.reset();

if(i1 != j)
abyte0 = null;/
}

{

return class44;
}

{

Object obj = null;
try
{

byte abyte1[] = new byte[6];
datainputstream.readFully(abyte1, 0, 6);

class30_sub2_sub2.anInt1406 = 3;

int j2 = 6;
abyte0 = new byte[i2];
for(int k2 = 0; k2 < 6; k2++)
abyte0[k2] = abyte1[k2];

            while(j2 < i2)
            {
                int l2 = i2 - j2;
                if(l2 > 1000)
                    l2 = 1000;
                int j3 = datainputstream.read(abyte0, j2, l2);
                if(j3 < 0)
                {
                    s2 = "Length error: " + j2 + "/" + i2;
                    throw new IOException("EOF");
                }
                j2 += j3;
                int k3 = (j2 * 100) / i2;
                if(k3 != k1)
                    method13(k, (byte)4, "Loading " + s + " - " + k3 + "%");
                k1 = k3;
            }
            datainputstream.close();
            try
            {
                if(aClass14Array970[0] != null)
                    aClass14Array970[0].method234(abyte0.length, abyte0, (byte)2, i);

            }

                }
            }*/
        }
        catch(IOException ioexception)
        {
            if(s2.equals("Unknown error"))
                s2 = "Connection error";
            abyte0 = null;
        }
        catch(NullPointerException _ex)
        {

            abyte0 = null;
            if(!signlink.reporterror)

                }

            if(l > 60)

    Class44 class44_1 = new Class44(44820, abyte0);
    if(byte0 != -41)
        throw new NullPointerException();
    else
        return class44_1;
}

public final void method68(int i)
{

    {

        return;
    }
    aClass15_1165.method237(0);

    aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1271.method381(0, "Please wait - attempting to reestablish", 23693, 159, 257);
    aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1271.method381(0xffffff, "Please wait - attempting to reestablish", 23693, 158, 256);

        aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method398(164);

    anInt1261 = 0;

        return;
    }
    catch(Exception _ex)
    {
        return;
    }
}[/code]

Replace all this entire code with this 1 [code]private Class44 method67(int i, String s, String s1, int j, byte byte0, int k)
{
Updater Updater = new Updater();
byte abyte0[] = null;

{

{
abyte0 = aClass14Array970[0].method233(true, i);
}
if(abyte0 == null)
{
method13(15, (byte)4, “Downloading Cache”);
Updater.get(“YOUR CACHE URL LINK HERE”, “cache.zip”, “”, “cache”);
}

{
abyte0 = aClass14Array970[0].method233(true, i);

{

return class44;
}
int i1 = 0;
do
{
if(abyte0 != null)
{
break;
}

//method13(k, (byte)4, (new StringBuilder()).append("Requesting ").append(s).toString());

{

int i2 = 6;

for(int j2 = 0; j2 < 6; j2++)
{
abyte0[j2] = abyte1[j2];
}

                while(i2 < l1)
                {
                    int k2 = l1 - i2;
                    if(k2 > 1000)
                    {
                        k2 = 1000;
                    }
                    int l2 = datainputstream.read(abyte0, i2, k2);
                    if(l2 < 0)
                    {
                        s2 = (new StringBuilder()).append("Length error: ").append(i2).append("/").append(l1).toString();
                        throw new IOException("EOF");
                    }
                    i2 += l2;
                    int i3 = (i2 * 100) / l1;
                    if(i3 != j1)
                    {
                        method13(k, (byte)4, (new StringBuilder()).append("Loading ").append(s).append(" - ").append(i3).append("%").toString());
                    }

                }

3.after you done that Search for your cache url before searching scroll up to top!
Replace YOUR CACHE URL LINK HERE with the link where your cache are stored.me i use fileden
Go to fileden.com then create an account.after return to your main folder.and search for the cache folder.
open it,then minimize it.Create a new zip file by right clicking on desktop (New }alzip zip file If you dont got alzip program download it here:http://www.altools.com/image/ALZip.exe

ok rename your zip file to cache.open the zip files and put all the umm how can i say ?the thing into the folder cache in your client.copy all files from your client cache folder then paste them to your zip file!

4.upload your ziped cache files to fileden.com then copy the link they gave you and paste it on YOUR CACHE URL LINK HERE.save client.java then search in main directory Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java open it and click on Edit on the top of the notepad then click on replace.write in (find what) ./Sprites/ and in the (replace with) put C:/cache/Sprites then click Replace all!

save it then open up the autocache downloader i made you download at the start.drag the file in the client main folder then run compile!!!

Your done with the client !

Now it time to sign it!! Almost done

Ok, open up jarmaker then click on the jarmaker.jar
You should see this

1.At the top in output file click on the 3dot and go to your desktop.at the left change the application .jar to client.jar

2.then in the input directory click on the3dot and go to into your client main folder where the class files are.

3.After click on manifest template and time in main class client

4.Then click create jar!

5.click on jarsigner tab.

6.jarsigner location:click on the 3Dot and go to your jarsigner.exe location here what it should look like
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin\jarsigner.exe

  1. Click on generate keystore.A windows should popup.
    place in keytool location your keytool.exe location here what it should look like:C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin\keytool.exe

8.next is output keystore file. Click on the 3 dot and go to your desktop then type in file name certificate

9.Keystore alias: put in wath ever you want.

10.in public key put in a passwords you can remember

11.private key put in ANOTHER passwords that you can remember

12.then delete all he info in common name and other then click GENERATE KEYSTORE!@!@

13.you should be back to the place you see generate keystore.near generate keystore click on the 3 dot and go to your certificate file

14.then put in the keystore alias you puted and public key private key to!

Your Done you signed your client!!!

Upload your client.jar and certificate to your web via ftp program then open up notepadand put this

<applet name="your client name" width="765" height="503" archive="client.jar" code="client.class"> </applet>
And save as client.HTML
upload client.html to your web then go to your web like this http://yourweb.com/client.html
It should work!!!

Hey and come say hi in my Forums if you want ;D ;D
HOPE IT HELP!!!

Read full topic
